page.title: 09Clay Pipe Works Crowedge
page.content: The discovery of rich but very{thin {iron ore seams}in the area led to the formation of{Hepworth Iron Company}by a group of textile men. The seams were difficult to work and the project lost money. Further exploration turned up workable{coal seams}which were mined until the late 1940's. During the mid 1800's an abundant, high{quality clay was discovered and bricks were made in connection with building of a reservoir.{Brickmaking}became a commercial venture - a characteristic blue brick and clayware pipes became a sideline which eventually made the company the largest producer of {vitrified clay pipes}and fittings for drainage and sewer purposes in the building industry. In 1922 the G.P.O. placed the first order with the company for conduit for ducting cables
